1500.name: A Road Leading From The Bank
1500.description:
The passage opens on a small road leading away from the edge of the
River of Lost Souls. The dark waters of the River can be seen and heard
just south of here. Looking to the east and west, you see only the walls
of the rocky cliffs. Off to the north a strange path seems to lead
straight into the depths of the mountain. The terrain rolls and dips
around. The wind carries the scent of wild herbs.

south.description: The River of Lost Souls flows just to the south of here.

1501.name: A Long Road
1501.description:
The area opens here in spiritual emptiness, beginning a long and
dangerous path. Your honest submission has already been made, but the
truth of your heart has yet to be told. Leave here now, and do not come
back until you have grown. The walls are rough-hewn and cold to the
touch. Dust motes drift in the stale air.

1502.name: A Long Road
1502.description:
You stop for a moment, screaming in frustration. Surely it was that one
sin that was avoidable, of all that you regret. The hitting and the
hurting flash briefly before. Moments later the pain passes, and the
straight path reveals itself before. Dust motes drift in the stale
air. The walls are rough-hewn and cold to the touch.

1503.name: A Long Road
1503.description:
The road clears, the fog and pain of the first few steps left behind.
Despite the sudden clarity, your mind is still haunted, images of an old
woman kneeling in prayer, eyes closing, smiling and crying. The walls
are rough-hewn and cold to the touch. The air is still and musty.

1504.name: A Long Road
1504.description:
Looking ahead, Visible is that the path you have been following will
soon come to an end, but something in the cold and the breeze tells you
that that will be only the beginning of the journey. The ceiling hangs
low overhead. Shadows gather in the corners.

1505.name: A Test for the Faithful
1505.description:
It is here finally that decisions must be made. The first one that
confronts you is simple enough, to walk in the darkness, or to walk in
the light. Only the depths of your soul can decide, but remember this
much: the same truth lies at the end of both paths. Dust motes drift in
the stale air. Shadows gather in the corners.

1506.name: Halls of the Forgotten
1506.description:
Even the darkest have a place on the road to the truth. It is in this
place, so empty and forgotten, that God has chosen the worst, and
brought them close to Him for one last time. The air is still and musty.
Dust motes drift in the stale air.

1507.name: Shahadah
1507.description:
It was written once, on an ancient parchment in a curious and flowing
script, that there is in fact no god but Allah, and that Muhammad was
the last of His Prophets. With this recognition, all else became empty
and meaningless. The air is still and musty. Shadows gather in the
corners.

1508.name: Earthly Evil
1508.description:
Whatever it carries, that rage converts into a weapon. Wrath supplies
all with arms. When an angry man thirsts for blood anything will serve
him for a spear. Fury turns a stick into a cudgel. Dust motes drift in
the stale air. Shadows gather in the corners.

1509.name: Misguidance
1509.description:
Some have been brought here not for what they did, but what they failed
to do. It is these, the poor souls that were presented the fair evidence
and rejected it with an honest mind, that deserve our pity the most of
all. Shadows gather in the corners. The air is still and musty.

1510.name: Temptation
1510.description:
Old tales tell of a conversation between the devil and the Prophet
Jesus: the devil offered him a kingdom, vast riches, the temptation of a
glorious near-death saved by his angels. Even this Messenger of God was
forced to stop and think. Imagine how hard it could be for the rest. The
ceiling hangs low overhead. Dust motes drift in the stale air.

1511.name: Hypocrisy
1511.description:
He called the populace to strict religious purity, rigidly enforcing the
times of prayer and the most correct forms of the words of the Muezzin.
All of this he strengthened by his most impeccable example, shunning all
riches and riding in tattered rags through his capital on the back of a
donkey. Despite all this, remember. Behind closed doors, all men are
hypocrites. Dust motes drift in the stale air. The air is still and
musty.

1512.name: Hate
1512.description:
There is little in life much easier, and truthfully, little that is a
quicker ticket to damnation. You give brief thanks that you have come to
the end of these trials, but your words are drowned out by something
much louder, a mechanical preaching that drowns your ears in anger. You
hear a steady, repetitive litany of the same phrase, over and over
again: "I go the way history dictates with the blind assurance of a
sleep-walker." The ceiling hangs low overhead. Dust motes drift in the
stale air.

1513.name: Spiritual Danger
1513.description:
Some evils are tangible, solid, so evident that they spit you right in
the face. Others are more clever, more subtle, and it is these that
present the greatest danger. Looking down the hall before, a great
fear fills your heart, and a great, heavy longing. Shadows gather in the
corners. The air is still and musty.

1514.name: The Fall
1514.description:
In the beginning, he was the best, the most beautiful of all the angels,
and God's most loved creation. Look at your own beauty, human, and do
what he could not. Look at your beauty, and learn to kneel! The air is
still and musty. Dust motes drift in the stale air.

1515.name: Temptation
1515.description:
Temptation is the IF, the wondering, the second-guessing, the "I will be
a better man... if..." And that if is usually taken, sitting alone,
listening to that voice, calling you, offering such an easy way, but
such a crooked one. The ceiling hangs low overhead. Shadows gather in
the corners.

1516.name: The Last Day
1516.description:
The din of a great battle shakes these halls, the moans of the earth
erupting at the shakings of the End Time. Be ready for that day, be very
ready, for if you are not, he will claim you for one of his own. The
walls are rough-hewn and cold to the touch. Dust motes drift in the
stale air.

1517.name: Flame
1517.description:
Undescribable horror and pain, a blackness drowned out only by the
burning anguish, the inextinguishable fire coming not from some burning
wood or molten lava but from the brightness and pain of the horrible,
tortured souls that surround, everywhere you turn. The walls are rough-
hewn and cold to the touch. Shadows gather in the corners.

1518.name: Earthly Light
1518.description:
To slip into evil is easy, but walking this path is the hardest of all.
Even the four you will find here today have strayed from the line at
least once in their lives, and there are still some living who curse the
very sound of their names. Despite all this, confront them now, and let
their actions serve as your example. Dust motes drift in the stale air.
The air is still and musty.

1519.name: The Light of the Rashidun
1519.description:
Many believed that the Prophet would never die, but when the stark
evidence of his body confronted them, it soon became necessary to
provide for the future. The four that came after are called the
Rashidun, the rightly-guided Caliphs that would spread the word and the
light, and with it forge one of history's greatest empires. The walls
are rough-hewn and cold to the touch. The air is still and musty.

1520.name: The Light of the Rashidun
1520.description:
The first Caliphs were chosen by consultation with a noble council of
elders, each of whom, hoping to lead the world of Islam alone, voted to
elect the one amongst them they thought was the weakest. Each time, they
were wrong. Each one was more noble, more upright than the one before.
The air is still and musty. Shadows gather in the corners.

1521.name: The Light of the Rashidun
1521.description:
Every majestic and happy tale must end, usually all too soon, and thus
it was with the golden age of the Caliphate. The Rashidun were pure men,
good men, true to the path, but their followers soon began to bicker,
and civil war was on the horizon. The ceiling hangs low overhead.
Shadows gather in the corners.

1522.name: The Light of the Rashidun
1522.description:
The end of the Rashidun was the beginning of Schism. The memories of the
Prophet and the living example of the Caliphs proved to be insufficient
example to the faithful. Ali died, and some say that with him the
Caliphate died too, a martyr, his blood still flowing in the nameless
river. The air is still and musty. Shadows gather in the corners.

1523.name: Spritual Reward
1523.description:
Behold, Allah is the Provider, the most Generous. He would not suffer
his believers to walk the path of light without guidance. He provided
the Prophets, may peace be upon them, and in the examples of their own
growth, we shall find the truth of our own. The ceiling hangs low
overhead. Shadows gather in the corners.

1524.name: Creation
1524.description:
In the creation of the heavens and the earth, and in the alternation of
night and day, there are signs for men of sense; those that remember
Allah say: "Lord, You have not created this in vain!" The air is still
and musty. Dust motes drift in the stale air.

1525.name: Revelation
1525.description:
The Angel Gabriel came to him and said: "Read!" He replied: "But I
cannot!" The order was repeated three times, until the Angel himself
said: "Read, in the name of your Lord who created man from clots of
blood. Praise be to God, Lord of the Universe." Shadows gather in the
corners. The walls are rough-hewn and cold to the touch.

1526.name: Conversion
1526.description:
Unbelievers, I do not worship what you worship, nor do you worship what
I worship. I shall never worship what you worship, nor will you ever
worship what I worship. You have your own religion, and I have mine.
Shadows gather in the corners. The ceiling hangs low overhead.

1527.name: Deliverance
1527.description:
The balance had been made, the soul placed in readiness, and the final
measurement taken. For those that have come this far, surely this is the
day of immortality! The air is still and musty. The ceiling hangs low
overhead.

1528.name: Repentance
1528.description:
God forgives those who commit evil in ignorance, for He is all-knowing
and wise. But He will not forgive those who do evil, and when death
comes to them, say: "Now we repent!" For those We have prepared a woeful
scourge. Shadows gather in the corners. The ceiling hangs low overhead.

1529.name: Pilgrimage
1529.description:
It is incumbent upon all Muslims to make the pilgrimage to Mecca once in
their lifetime, if they are able, and for those unfortunate enough to
follow the lives of the lower evils, such a pilgrimage with an open and
contrite heart shall absolve them of all. The ceiling hangs low
overhead. Dust motes drift in the stale air.

1530.name: Intercession
1530.description:
It is written that no one may intercede with God on behalf of another.
No prayers from another may save the soul of a doomed man; his only hope
is prayers of his own. Dust motes drift in the stale air. Shadows gather
in the corners.

1531.name: The Upper Reaches
1531.description:
You have traveled the righteous path, and you have faced the examples of
the true models of the Prophet. Only the final journey awaits you; live
like this and you shall live forever. The ceiling hangs low overhead.
Dust motes drift in the stale air.

1532.name: The Upper Reaches
1532.description:
When the records of men's deeds are laid open, and heaven is stripped
bare; when Hell burns fiercely and Paradise is brought near: then each
soul shall know what it has done. Shadows gather in the corners. Dust
motes drift in the stale air.

1533.name: The Upper Reaches
1533.description:
You have traveled the righteous path, and your own journey has imitated
the evolution of the most perfect soul. Only one final path awaits you;
die as the one in the room before, and your death will mean nothing.
Shadows gather in the corners. The ceiling hangs low overhead.

1534.name: The Final Facing
1534.description:
The last of the darkness lies behind; only the straight path remains. Go
forth with a clean heart. Only the penitent shall find what they seek.
Shadows gather in the corners. Dust motes drift in the stale air.

1535.name: The Final Facing
1535.description:
The last of the darkness lies behind; only the straight path remains. Go
forth with a clean heart. Only the penitent shall find what they seek.
The walls are rough-hewn and cold to the touch. The ceiling hangs low
overhead.

1536.name: The Final Facing
1536.description:
The last of the darkness lies behind; only the straight path remains. Go
forth with a clean heart. Only the penitent shall find what they seek.
The ceiling hangs low overhead. Dust motes drift in the stale air.

1537.name: A Straight Path
1537.description:
The Compassionate, the Merciful, Sovereign of the Day of Judgment! You
alone we worship, and to You alone we turn for help. Guide us to the
Straight Path, the path of those whom You have favored, not of those who
have gone astray. Shadows gather in the corners. The walls are rough-
hewn and cold to the touch.

1538.name: Progression
1538.description:
Were We worn out by the First Creation? Yet they are in doubt about a
new creation. WE created man. We know the promptings of his soul, and
are closer to him than his jugular vein. The ceiling hangs low overhead.
Shadows gather in the corners.

1539.name: Judgment
1539.description:
Undoubtedly the shortest path is the straightest one. Only one more step
awaits before a final decision is made and a home given to you for all
eternity. Shadows gather in the corners. The walls are rough-hewn and
cold to the touch.

1540.name: The Utmost Throne
1540.description:
You have come at last to the resting place of the most holy. Startling
crystal clarity of vision has been granted to you; seven guardians rim
the periphery of the throne and all is bathed in a warm and clean light.
It is here that the final choice is to be made, and no defiance of yours
can change the outcome. The ceiling hangs low overhead. The walls are
rough-hewn and cold to the touch.

1500.name: allah
1500.long_desc: You resist the urge to avert your eyes from the sight of the one true God.
1500.description:
The sight is for each man a different, a mirror into the true nature of
each person's body and soul.  At first a proud, bitter old man, but just
as easily a gentle extended hand, a smile, and gardens... gardens.

1501.name: michael
1501.long_desc: The archangel Michael turns and begins to look you over.
1501.description:
At first you see nothing but a bright and comforting glow; then the
image sharpens suddenly, and you see a face, eyes, hands, but then
that too fades, and you see nothing.

1502.name: gabriel
1502.long_desc: The archangel Gabriel smiles, and begins to tell you something.
1502.description:
Known as the Messenger, it is this angel that has brought the Divine Word
to the chosen prophets, and in turn brought the Seal of the Prophets on a
miraculous journey to the holy city of Jerusalem.

1503.name: raphael
1503.long_desc: The archangel Raphael looks up and frowns at you in disapproval.
1503.description:
It is impossible to get a solid glance at the archangel.  He is nothing
that is human, and with a mere whisper, he dispels every image that you
attempt to create in your mind.

1504.name: uriel
1504.long_desc: Uriel, the angel of darkness, stands here guarding the way forward.
1504.description:
After the Fall of the bringer of light, the Lord had need for the
service of a fourth, and it was this angel, Uriel, that rose to the
highest ranks.

1505.name: cherub
1505.long_desc: The cherubin of the blazing sword looks at you and begins to chuckle.
1505.description:
The monster before you seems to be nothing more than a baby or young
child, wrapped in a glowing white cloth, but as you try to walk past,
the beast grins and cackles, drawing its sword and blocking the way.

1506.name: jester
1506.long_desc: A mad, drunken jester is sitting here, lost in his deepening stupor.
1506.description:
He is dimly aware of your gaze.  Chuckling softly, you hear him mutter
something obscure: dragons, the temple, the falling of great empires.
He laughs at you and takes another drink.

1507.name: jinn
1507.long_desc: One of the jinn dances in and out of the air before your eyes, taunting you.
1507.description:
You have heard legends of these creatures, the mischievous little demons
said to be trapped in lamps and bottles, capable of granting all kinds of
powerful wishes.  To you, it looks like nothing more than an annoying little
sprite.

1508.name: man
1508.long_desc: A slumped, shaking old man stands up and begins to yell at the world.
1508.description:
He wears a faded uniform, decorated with honors of his own creation,
slackened jaws and pasty white bags sagging under his ugly, hating eyes.
A tuft of reckless dark hair scatters across his forehead, and his right
hand shakes and shakes.

1509.name: caliph
1509.long_desc: The mad Caliph al-Hakim is here, dissecting a young boy.
1509.description:
The darkest skin, and eyes so white.  Covered only in a shoddy woolen
tunic, he has not bathed in months nor eaten in days, and yet his smile,
so charming.

1510.name: judas
1510.long_desc: The wayward apostle approaches slowly, extending his arms in a hug.
1510.description: You see nothing but the sadness of a man who would sell his own God.

1511.name: pharoah
1511.long_desc: Pharoah has been sent here in retribution for a lifetime of evils.
1511.description:
Richly clothed and postured in arrogance and love of power, he looks at
you with nothing more than a smirk of contempt.

1512.name: abu
1512.long_desc: Abu Bakr, first of the Rashidun, mourns over the death of the Prophet.
1512.description:
You see a simple man, dressed in dark and unadorned robes, bent over and
pensive, reliving the memories of a man he never thought would die.

1513.name: umar
1513.long_desc: You see Umar, second of the Rashidun, the successors of the Prophet.
1513.description:
You are amazed at the piety of the man.  He looks at you in sadness,
saying: "I do not wish to fight you, but if you refuse the truth of
the Word, then I must."

1514.name: uthman
1514.long_desc: The third of the rightly-guided Caliphs, Uthman, stands before you.
1514.description:
He was chosen as leader by a clique of jealous rivals who could agree
upon no other.  The memory of the Prophet fading quickly from the minds
of the faithful, he could do little, and was in the end killed by his
enemies.

1515.name: ali
1515.long_desc: You have come before Ali, fourth and last of the Rashidun.
1515.description:
Some view him as the closest to God among all of the Caliphs, the one
most deserving of our respect and reverence.  Still others saw him as
a schismatic, a heretic, one to be killed and forgotten.  To look at
him now is for you to decide for yourself.

1516.name: angel
1516.long_desc: You gaze in awe at the most beautiful of all angels, Iblis, the Fallen.
1516.description:
He smiles calmly, and begins to tell you of the time when he would not
kneel, would not prostrate himself before the first human beings.  And
then he gestures at you, smiling, and conjures an image of all the 
temptations that will be yours if you in turn but follow him.

1517.name: iblis
1517.long_desc: You pause nervously as a voice whispers at you from over your shoulder.
1517.description:
There is no physical figure attached to the presence that dominates this
place, just tormented laughter, moaning, screaming, and begging.

1518.name: serpent
1518.long_desc: A raging dragon turns to you in violent lust for your soul.
1518.description:
The serpent of babylon, the aged and violet hued monster that has 
watched all of mankind succumb before its power, turns to you as
its last victim.

1519.name: demon
1519.long_desc: The hell-fire around you is dominated by a massive, burning demon.
1519.description:
You see nothing but the inexorably red and burning anger of the 
lord of the underworld that you fear to be your fate.

1520.name: baby
1520.long_desc: Lying on the ground wrapped in blankets is the most innocent of babies.
1520.description:
The baby is barely aware of your presence, lost in a sleepy and
contented yawn.

1521.name: boy
1521.long_desc: You stop in surprise at the sight of a teenage boy staring off to the distance.
1521.description:
He is young, and has not yet seen the bloodiness of this world.  You follow
his gaze and notice that he is gazing in wonderment at the fullness of the
moon.

1522.name: man
1522.long_desc: A middle-aged man is here, kneeling in prayer.
1522.description:
He is tired, the lines of age marking his face, but in his robe, 
kneeling, he is the image of perfect contentment.

1523.name: soul
1523.long_desc: You are overwhelmed by the presence of a soul that has transcended its body.
1523.description:
You sense certain tastes and smells, the winds through the gardens.
Nothing can explain or describe this perfection, this utter bliss.

1500.name: scales
1500.room_desc: Two beautiful plates shaped like scales have been left here.

1501.name: scroll
1501.room_desc: You see a solid and silver-lined scroll resting on the ground.

1502.name: sword
1502.room_desc: You are startled by the sight of a sword that glows as you approach it.

1503.name: protector
1503.room_desc: A weighty looking shield has been abandoned by one unworthy to hold it.

1504.name: armband
1504.room_desc: A ragged and faded looking piece of cloth has been left here, forgotten.

1505.name: scimitar
1505.room_desc: A stunning curved blade glistens on the ground.

1506.name: ember
1506.room_desc: You glance briefly at a smouldering ember that rests at your feet.

1507.name: ethereal
1507.room_desc: The entire room is aglow from the flame at your feet.

1508.name: key
1508.room_desc: You have found at last the Key to the Gates of eternity.

1509.name: history
1509.room_desc: You have found a burnt book, some forgotten history lying on the ground.

1510.name: surah
1510.room_desc: You notice a thin parchment, with flowing script and rich decorative trim.

1511.name: forge
1511.room_desc: It is surely the best of men who has left these gloves to aid you.

1512.name: ankh
1512.room_desc: You see a beautiful pendant of ancient and noble craftsmanship.

1513.name: amulet
1513.room_desc: You have found a beautiful gleaming disc with a golden image of the sun god.

1514.name: image
1514.room_desc: You frown in disgust at the hideous icon of a false god that you have found.
